title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

We are looking for the application of the relationship between the increasing and decreasing behavior of the first derivative and the points of inflection of the original function.

The first point is earned for “none,” with some relevant mathematical discussion.

The reasoning point is most commonly earned by correctly appealing to the increasing behavior of g ′ . MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaacaGGUaaaaa@34DC@

An appeal to g ″ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbayaaaaa@342D@ must address the consideration of both g ″ =0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbayaacqGH9aqpca aIWaaaaa@35ED@ and g ″ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbayaaaaa@342D@ undefined.

The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

Make sure the response addresses the average value of g ′ , MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaacaGGSaaaaa@34DA@ not of g.

The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus point is earned for the expression g ( 10 )−g ( 0 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F0C@

The answer point is earned only for the correct answer. The values of 15 and −3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaIZaaaaa@34DC@ must be shown.

1 10 ( 15−( −3 ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C95@ earns both points.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The student must establish that g is a continuous function. The most common, and acceptable, response is “differentiable implies continuous.”

The student must convey that differentiability implies continuity. Stating g is differentiable and continuous, does not earn the first point.

The response that mentions continuity without establishing continuity is still eligible for the second point.

Using, or citing, the Mean Value Theorem will not earn the second point.

To earn the second point the student must explicitly convey an appropriate inequality involving 0, either mathematically or in words. For example, −3<0<15 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3918@ or g ( 0 )<0<g ( 10 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40E1@

The second point requires an answer of “yes” or an equivalent statement.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

Some (incorrect) responses claim that evaluation of the integrand is equal to the value of the integral.

The first point requires demonstration of both the sum of integrals and the multiplication by a constant.

4 ⋅ 38+5 ⋅ 10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@438C@ earns both points. This is the minimal supporting work required.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The minimal supporting computations required are 15−10+2 sin 10 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F48@ This alone would earn the point.

The student does not have to evaluate sin 10. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39BE@

An answer of just “ 7 sin 10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39DD@ ” does not earn the point because it does not show the minimal computations.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

A response of only e x  ⋅ g ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FE6@ earns only the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus point.

Some responses may reverse the limits of integration and state this is equal to the original integral. This incorrect approach could earn only the first two points, but will not earn the answer point, unless the student resolves the limits reversal issue.

The answer point can only be earned if both of the first two points are earned, and the given answer is correct.

1 ⋅ ( −38 )+1 ⋅ ( −3 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47B8@ earns all three points.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

If the student writes the integral with x ⋅  g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3ED1@ as the integrand, we need to see that it is equal to the integral with A ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGbbGaaGjcVpaabmaabaGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@380F@ for the integrand.

So, ∫ 0 10 A ( x )  dx = ∫ 0 10 x ⋅  g ′  ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5765@ earns the point.

Some responses introduce another variable, or function, for example, R ( x )= g ′  ( x ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EE5@ before writing the final expression in terms of this other variable. This earns the point. For example, A ( x )=x ⋅ R ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4493@ in the presence of R ( x )= g ′  ( x ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EE7@

The point is not earned if the correct integrand appears only in part (h).
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

If there is no integration by parts, no points are earned in this part.

The integration by parts point is for an “indefinite integration by parts.” The bounds are associated with the answer point.

Minimal work required to earn the integration by parts point: 10 ⋅ 15−0−38 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FB8@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part I
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

Many students will write the antiderivative without any evidence of substitution. This antiderivative must be completely correct to earn the substitution point.

Limit notation must be used in order to earn the improper integral point.

The student must earn the improper integral point to be eligible for the answer point.

If the student uses an explicit substitution and makes an error in the limits, they cannot earn the answer point.

A response can earn the substitution point for working only with an indefinite integral.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.
